channel.title: .pack200

item.title: .pack200
item.dc:creator: @byte byte
item.description:
@byte wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:9, topic:2990”]Corrupted pack file: magic/ver = 08000000/0.0 should be CAFED00D/150.7

CafeDood? ;)[/quote]

0xCAFED00D is simply a hexadecimal magic number, it’s to validate that a file is a certain type. I don’t know if you’ve ever messed with bytecode but the magic number of a java class is 0xCAFEBABE. As someone said above, use the unpacker Jagex “provides”, I’m guessing runescape.pack200 is encrypted. Don’t quote me on it. Although, why else would the byte positions of the magic number be 08000000 and the version, 0.0?

Read full topic

item.title: .pack200
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

You can use that code or just the unpack200.exe utility that comes with JDK 1.5. Unfortunately, when I tried it earlier it told me that the file was corrupted, so I assume it’s packaged even further. I plan to look into it further tomorrow. But here was what the utlity told me:

unpack200 -v runescape.pack200 runescape.jar

Unpacking from runescape.pack200 to rs.jar
com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.unpack.log.file=-
unpack.deflate.hint=(not set)
com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.unpack.remove.packfile=false
com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.verbose=1
com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.unpack.modification.time=(not set)
Corrupted pack file: magic/ver = 08000000/0.0 should be CAFED00D/150.7

Edit: Reread your post, and it’s probably the same error as I got…Since it’s a magic number error, I assumed it was compressed further somehow. I found one bug report similar to this error, but not exactly: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6323632

Read full topic

item.title: .pack200
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Well, if you go to se3.runescape.com/runescape.pack200, you’ll find a pack200 file. Well, what the hell is this? It’s a further compressed jarfile, what Jagex is using it for god knows. I’d like to extract it, but I’m getting an error, saying something along the lines of the version of the pack200 file and my extractor aren’t the same. Can someone download it and try it? I’m very curious to what’s in it.

I got this code from the API.

[code]import java.util.;
import java.util.jar.;
import java.util.jar.Pack200.;
import java.io.;

public class unPacker {

public unPacker() {
	Packer packer = Pack200.newPacker();

	Map p = packer.properties();

	p.put(Packer.EFFORT, "7");  // default is "5"

	p.put(Packer.SEGMENT_LIMIT, "-1");

	p.put(Packer.KEEP_FILE_ORDER, Packer.FALSE);

	p.put(Packer.MODIFICATION_TIME, Packer.LATEST);

	p.put(Packer.DEFLATE_HINT, Packer.FALSE);

	p.put(Packer.CODE_ATTRIBUTE_PFX + "LineNumberTable", Packer.STRIP);

	p.put(Packer.UNKNOWN_ATTRIBUTE, Packer.ERROR);

	try {
		/*JarFile jarFile = new JarFile("runescape.jar");//This part writes runescape.jar into runescape.pack200
		FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("runescape.pack200");
		packer.pack(jarFile, fos);
		jarFile.close();
		fos.close();*/

		File f = new File("runescape.pack200");//This part writes runescape.pack200 into runescape.jar
		FileOutputStream fostream = new FileOutputStream("runescape_pack200.jar");
		JarOutputStream jostream = new JarOutputStream(fostream);
		Unpacker unpacker = Pack200.newUnpacker();
		unpacker.unpack(f, jostream);
		jostream.close();
	}
	catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	}
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
	new unPacker();
}

}[/code]

By the way, I’ve made several pack200 files out of jars and extracted them succesfully, but this one’s being dumb.

Read full topic
